Don't open the door if you're not prepared to answer it. 

Asking "How are you?” can provide an opportunity for employees to be open/honest.

An "Um" and moving on isn't leadership. It disrespects the employee's vulnerability.

Create psychological safety, not a facade of caring.
Thanks so much for sharing, Kate!

Reminder: Don’t use “communication” in the place of “broadcasting”. 
Communication is two- way: what is said and what is understood.  
Broadcasting is one-way: talking at, not with. 

This works for employees and customers. #EX
